comments:
If you install WST from the Callisto update site, eclipse will no longer start.  A little experimentation revealed that installing the pre-reqs for WST works just fine.  It is only after installing WST (you don't have to install the J2EE component to get the fail), will the fail occur.

Untar a fresh 3.2M5a or the latest integration build I20060328-0010
Start eclipse (this works just fine)
Use the update manager to Find and Install from the Callisto update site
Select the Web Tools Platform
Press Select Required
Install all of the new plug-ins
Select Yes to restart the workbench

Optionally, install EMF, GEF, and JEM first, restart, then install WST.

The following prints to the console:

_X11TransSocketOpen: socket() failed for local
_X11TransSocketOpenCOTSClient: Unable to open socket for local
_X11TransOpen: transport open failed for local/tritium.austin.ibm.com:0

Eclipse will no longer start up.

Here is the log file:

Bryan, do you set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME on your linux system? 
I don't recall details, but there's some swt browser things that needs this, perhaps only on some versions of linux, but I think it results in that type of "no more handles" error. 

On my linux system, I use the following in my .bashrc
declare -X MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME="/usr/lib/mozilla-1.4.3/"

If possible, that might be a "quick test" for you to try, to see if related. 

Thanks,

See bug 103611 and and bug 103628. 

If this is indeed the problem, seems as though some base code has changed to not even print the warning that MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME not defined.
Bryan, can you increase the number of handles to try to get by the startup? Perhaps WTP really does need more handles. I assume these are file handles.

I do not set MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME.  I tried

export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/usr/lib/mozilla-1.7.12

and that did not work.

How do I increase the number of available handles?

See the history and discussion in bug 106396.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 106396 ***

Billy, thanks for catching. 
Bryon, thanks for verifying that 
setting JAVA_HIGH_ZIPFDS=500  
fixes the problem.
